parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the Continuously Variable Transmission (CVT) can cause the vehicle to shake, jerk, or hesitate while accelerating, decelerating, or cruising, which can lead to accidents or leave the driver stranded.
symptoms: The vehicle shakes or vibrates while driving
the transmission judders or hesitates
the vehicle slows down or loses power
the check engine light may or may not illuminate
error codes such as P17FO
P17F1
or P17F2 may appear.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the control arms can cause loss of steering control, leading to accidents or near-miss situations, especially at high speeds.
symptoms: The vehicle jerks in one direction or the other
loss of steering control
need for frequent front-end alignments
vibration or crunching sounds from the suspension.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the transmission and suspension can cause vibrations, crunching sounds, and loss of control, leading to accidents or near-miss situations, especially at high speeds.
symptoms: Vibration and crunching sounds from the transmission and suspension
transmission blocking or hesitation
loss of control
inability to safely use the vehicle.

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the brake sensor switch can cause the brake lights to malfunction, leading to reduced visibility and increased risk of accidents.
symptoms: The brake lights do not turn on
the brake lights stay on constantly
the brake lights flicker or flash
the vehicle's anti-lock braking system (ABS) warning light illuminates
the vehicle's traction control system (TCS) warning light illuminates.
